comment_data.body:
```suggestion
	f	scan buffer names (as opposed to buffer contents)
```

 		|i_CTRL-X_CTRL-D|
 	]	tag completion
 	t	same as "]"
+	f	scan the words that are the part of listed buffers

comment_data.body:
- We want to link to the 'complete' option docs here. Options are linked with single quotes in help docs. Also, there is no tag for `|complete|`.
- Flags should use double quotes.

```suggestion
â€¢ 'complete' option supports "f" flag for completing buffer names.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -189,6 +189,8 @@ The following new APIs and features were added.
 
 â€¢ Added |:fclose| command.
 
+â€¢ |complete| option supports `f` flag for completing buffer names.

@@ -189,6 +189,8 @@ The following new APIs and features were added.
 
 â€¢ Added |:fclose| command.
 
+â€¢ |complete| option supports `f` flag for completing buffer names.

comment_data.body:
I'd suggest just write

```
if is_win then
   screen:expect{grid=...}
else
   screen:expect{grid=...}
end
```
It is fine if screen tests are verbose (non DRY) to make is easier to see what is going on at a quick glance.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1228,4 +1228,39 @@ describe('completion', function()
     expect('colorscheme NOSUCHCOLORSCHEME')
     assert_alive()
   end)
+
+  it('complete with f flag #25598', function()
+    screen:try_resize(20, 9)
+    local bufname = 'foo/bar.txt'
+    local hidden = 'fooA/.hidden'
+    local is_win = helpers.is_os('win')
+    local head = {
+      "foo^                 |",
+      "{2:foo            }{0:     }|",
+    }
+    if is_win then
+      bufname = 'C:\\foo\\bar.txt'
+      hidden = 'C:\\fooA\\.hidden'
+      head = {
+        "C:^                  |",
+        "{2:C:             }{0:     }|",
+        "{1:foo            }{0:     }|",
+      }
+    end
+    command('set complete+=f | edit '.. bufname ..' | edit '..hidden)
+    feed('i<C-n>')
+
+    local grid = {
+      "{1:bar            }{0:     }|",
+      "{1:txt            }{0:     }|",
+      "{1:fooA           }{0:     }|",
+      "{1:.hidden        }{0:     }|",
+      "{0:~                   }|",
+      ("{3:-- }{4:match 1 of %d}     |"):format(is_win and 6 or 5),
+    }
+    if not is_win then
+      table.insert(grid, #grid - 1, "{0:~                   }|")
+    end
+    screen:expect{grid=table.concat(vim.list_extend(head,grid), '\n')}

@@ -1228,4 +1228,39 @@ describe('completion', function()
     expect('colorscheme NOSUCHCOLORSCHEME')
     assert_alive()
   end)
+
+  it('complete with f flag #25598', function()
+    screen:try_resize(20, 9)
+    local bufname = 'foo/bar.txt'
+    local hidden = 'fooA/.hidden'
+    local is_win = helpers.is_os('win')
+    local head = {
+      "foo^                 |",
+      "{2:foo            }{0:     }|",
+    }
+    if is_win then
+      bufname = 'C:\\foo\\bar.txt'
+      hidden = 'C:\\fooA\\.hidden'
+      head = {
+        "C:^                  |",
+        "{2:C:             }{0:     }|",
+        "{1:foo            }{0:     }|",
+      }
+    end
+    command('set complete+=f | edit '.. bufname ..' | edit '..hidden)
+    feed('i<C-n>')
+
+    local grid = {
+      "{1:bar            }{0:     }|",
+      "{1:txt            }{0:     }|",
+      "{1:fooA           }{0:     }|",
+      "{1:.hidden        }{0:     }|",
+      "{0:~                   }|",
+      ("{3:-- }{4:match 1 of %d}     |"):format(is_win and 6 or 5),
+    }
+    if not is_win then
+      table.insert(grid, #grid - 1, "{0:~                   }|")
+    end
+    screen:expect{grid=table.concat(vim.list_extend(head,grid), '\n')}

comment_data.body: ideally we would use some function in `path.c` to split things by the delimiters for the os. maybe `path_next_component()` can be used. Unlike `os_strtok` it won't null-terminate the string but we can always send in a computed length to `ins_compl_add()`

Let's try to use "bufname" consistently to avoid confusion with buffer _contents_.
```suggestion
static void get_next_bufname_token(void)
```

I think we can simplify the code to not need a duplicate `ins_compl_add(...)`. you can remove this if check here, the next iteration of `while (true)` will handle it just fine even if `*p = NUL`. then just check for this condition before calling `path_next_component()` instead.
maybe better names would be `start` and `current` respectively?

we don't want to mutate the string in place if we can avoid it (avoids an extra copy). If the intention here is to change `foobar.txt` so "foobar" becomes the suggested completion, `len` could be adjusted instead.
can inline `flags` to where it is used, and move `char *p` to the line where it is initialized.

comment_data.body: A small comment above here like `// treat . as a separator, unless it is the first char in a filename`
all done. just some unrelated test cases failed.

comment_regular_data.body:
Thanks @glepnir . 

However this doesn't seem to consider the current text when listing completions. E.g. if the cursor is after "f", then `ctrl-n` shows buffers that don't start with "f"

![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/1359421/c38a657c-f320-44ed-a5be-1a45b3826ae1)

need something like this
```C
    if (b->b_p_bl && b->b_sfname != NULL
        && strncmp(b->b_sfname, compl_first_match->cp_str,
                   strlen(compl_first_match->cp_str)) == 0) {
```
